feature.name: Monastic Tradition: Way of the Momentum (HB)
feature.text:
The Way of Momentum is taught by understanding the movements of the natural world and moving with them. Those who follow the Way of Momentum might do so to feel more in tune with nature and its patterns. They may be travelers deciding where to travel based on the wind, water, and the feel of nature, while others act as sages that read the flow of nature and offer advice to others.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 18 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Bonus Proficiencies (Way of the Momentum (HB))
feature.text:
You gain proficiency in the Nature skill if you don't already have it.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 18 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Rolling Body (Way of the Momentum (HB))
feature.text:
As a reaction when you are dealt bludgeoning, cold, fire, force, lightning, or thunder damage, you can spend 1 ki point to move with the flow of the attack and move up to 10 feet in any direction except for towards the source of the damage. You also gain resistance to the source of damage until the start of your next turn. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. Additionally, you can reduce the damage of melee attacks with your Deflect Missiles feature. If you reduce the damage to 0, you can make an unarmed strike against the attacker if they are within range.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 18 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Resonating Strike (Way of the Momentum (HB))
feature.text:
Your impacts sing through your targets with the whistling of multidimensional winds. Your unarmed strikes deal force damage instead of bludgeoning damage. Whenever you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 1 ki point to force the creature to succeed on a Strength saving throw or be subjected to one of the following effects:
• The creature is pushed 10 feet in a direction of your choice.
• The creature takes an additional amount of damage equal to your martial arts die.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 19 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Flowing Nature (Way of the Momentum (HB))
feature.text:
11th-level Way of Momentum feature You gain the ability to move with the momentum of your environment, granting you the following benefits:
• When you become submerged in water you gain a swim speed equal to your movement speed until you are out of water. You cannot, however, move against the flow of water. For example, you cannot swim up a waterfall.
• You are considered to be under the effects of a freedom of movement spell anytime you have all of your hit points. If your current hit points are lower than your maximum hit points, you can spend 2 ki points to regain this benefit until you take damage.
• You can spend 2 ki points to gain a flying speed equal to your current walking speed. This speed only lasts for 1 minute or until you stop moving. Whichever comes first...
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 19 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Shifting Spirit (Way of the Momentum (HB))
feature.text:
You can now use your Rolling Body feature for any damage type except psychic. Additionally, you may spend 2 ki points instead of 1 to gain resistance to the damage until you take damage of another type or until 1 minute has passed, whichever comes first. While you have this resistance, you can spend 1 ki point on each of your turns to deal additional damage of that type equal to your martial arts die.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 19 (Homebrew)
